thread.title: Direct Characterization of a Reactive Lattice-Confined Ru2 Nitride by Photocrystallography
thread.title_full: Direct Characterization of a Reactive Lattice-Confined Ru2 Nitride by Photocrystallography

author: Anuvab Das, Joseph H. Reibenspies, Yu-Sheng Chen and David C. Powers
title: Direct Characterization of a Reactive Lattice-Confined Ru2 Nitride by Photocrystallography
text: Publication Date (Web): February 14, 2017 Copyright © 2017 American Chemical Society * Abstract Reactive metal–ligand (M–L) multiply bonded complexes are ubiquitous intermediates in redox catalysis and have thus been long-standing targets of synthetic chemistry. The intrinsic reactivity of mid-to-late M–L multiply bonded complexes renders these structures challenging to isolate and structurally characterize. Although synthetic tuning of the ancillary ligand field can stabilize M–L multiply bonded complexes and result in isolable complexes, these efforts inevitably attenuate the reactivity of the M–L multiple bond. Here, we report the first direct characterization of a reactive Ru 2 nitride intermediate by photocrystallography. Photogeneration of reactive M–L multiple bonds within crystalline matrices supports direct characterization of these critical intermediates without synthetic derivatization. The Supporting Information is available free of charge on the ACS Publications website at DOI: 10.1021/jacs.6b13357 .
